LeBron James.passage: LeBron James is an American professional basketball player who currently plays for the Los Angeles Lakers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). Widely considered one of the greatest basketball players of all time, James has won four NBA championships, four NBA Most Valuable Player (MVP) Awards, and two Olympic gold medals. Born on December 30, 1984, in Akron, Ohio, James was raised by his mother, Gloria, who struggled to make ends meet. Despite his difficult upbringing, James showed a natural talent for basketball from a young age and quickly became a star player at St. Vincent-St. Mary High School in Akron. In 2003, James was selected as the first overall pick in the NBA draft by the Cleveland Cavaliers. He quickly established himself as one of the league's top players, earning Rookie of the Year honors in his first season. Over the next several years, James led the Cavaliers to multiple playoff appearances, but the team was unable to win a championship. In 2010, James made the controversial decision to leave Cleveland and join the Miami Heat. Alongside fellow All-Stars Dwyane Wade and Chris Bosh, James led the Heat to four consecutive NBA Finals appearances, winning two championships in 2012 and 2013. After four seasons in Miami, James returned to Cleveland in 2014 and led the Cavaliers to their first-ever NBA championship in 2016, overcoming a 3-1 deficit in the Finals against the Golden State Warriors. James was named Finals MVP for the third time in his career. In 2018, James signed with the Lakers, where he continues to play today. Despite being in his mid-30s, James remains one of the league's top players, earning All-NBA honors in each of his first two seasons with the Lakers. Off the court, James is known for his philanthropic work, particularly through his LeBron James Family Foundation, which focuses on education and community development initiatives in his hometown of Akron. James has also been an outspoken advocate for social justice issues, using his platform to speak out against police brutality and racial inequality. Overall, LeBron James is widely regarded as one of the greatest basketball players of all time, with his combination of size, athleticism, and skill making him a dominant force on the court. His impact on the game of basketball and his contributions to his community have made him a beloved figure both on and off the court.

Serena Williams.passage: Serena Williams is an American professional tennis player who is widely regarded as one of the greatest tennis players of all time. Born on September 26, 1981, in Saginaw, Michigan, Williams began playing tennis at the age of three under the guidance of her father, Richard Williams. Along with her older sister, Venus Williams, Serena quickly rose through the ranks of junior tennis and turned professional in 1995 at the age of 14. Throughout her career, Williams has won a total of 23 Grand Slam singles titles, the most by any player in the Open Era. She has also won 14 Grand Slam doubles titles with her sister Venus, and two mixed doubles titles. In addition to her Grand Slam success, Williams has won four Olympic gold medals, three in women's doubles and one in singles. Williams is known for her powerful serve and aggressive playing style, as well as her mental toughness and ability to come back from difficult situations. She has been ranked world No. 1 in singles on eight separate occasions, and has spent a total of 319 weeks at the top of the rankings, the most by any player in history. Off the court, Williams is also a successful entrepreneur and philanthropist. She has launched her own fashion line, Serena, and has invested in several startups, including the dating app Bumble. She is also a vocal advocate for social justice and has used her platform to speak out on issues such as police brutality and gender equality. Despite facing numerous setbacks and injuries throughout her career, Williams has continued to dominate the sport of tennis and inspire fans around the world with her talent and resilience. She remains a true icon of the game and a role model for aspiring athletes everywhere.

Cristiano Ronaldo.passage: Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro, commonly known as Cristiano Ronaldo, is a Portuguese professional footballer who plays as a forward for Serie A club Juventus and captains the Portugal national team. Often considered one of the best players in the world, he is widely regarded as one of the greatest footballers of all time. Ronaldo began his career as a youth player for Andorinha, where he played for two years, before moving to C.D. Nacional. In 1997, he made a move to Portuguese giants Sporting CP, where he quickly rose through the ranks of the youth academy and made his first team debut in 2002. After a standout performance in a friendly match against Manchester United, he caught the eye of Sir Alex Ferguson, who signed him for the English club in 2003. During his time at Manchester United, Ronaldo won three Premier League titles, one UEFA Champions League title, and one FIFA Club World Cup. He also won his first Ballon d'Or award in 2008, which he would go on to win four more times throughout his career. In 2009, Ronaldo made a record-breaking transfer to Spanish giants Real Madrid for a fee of €94 million, where he would go on to become the club's all-time top scorer with 450 goals in 438 appearances. During his time at Real Madrid, he won four UEFA Champions League titles, two La Liga titles, and two FIFA Club World Cups. He also won four more Ballon d'Or awards, bringing his total to five. In 2018, Ronaldo made another record-breaking transfer, this time to Italian club Juventus for a fee of €100 million. In his first season with the club, he helped them win the Serie A title and was named the league's Most Valuable Player. Ronaldo has also had a successful international career, having captained Portugal to victory in the 2016 UEFA European Championship and the 2019 UEFA Nations League. He is the country's all-time top scorer with 111 goals in 180 appearances. Off the pitch, Ronaldo is known for his philanthropic work, having donated millions of dollars to various charities and causes throughout his career. He is also one of the most followed athletes on social media, with over 500 million followers across various platforms. Overall, Ronaldo's career has been marked by numerous individual and team accolades, cementing his status as one of the greatest footballers of all time.

Simone Biles.passage: Simone Biles is an American artistic gymnast who is widely considered one of the greatest gymnasts of all time. Born on March 14, 1997, in Columbus, Ohio, Biles was raised by her grandparents, who adopted her and her younger sister after their mother struggled with addiction. Biles began gymnastics at the age of six, and quickly showed a natural talent for the sport. Biles made her debut on the international stage in 2013, when she competed at the American Cup and won the all-around title. She went on to win the all-around title at the U.S. National Championships that year, and then won the all-around title at the World Championships in Antwerp, Belgium. Biles became the first African-American woman to win the all-around title at the World Championships. Biles continued to dominate the sport in the years that followed. She won the all-around title at the U.S. National Championships every year from 2013 to 2016, and won the all-around title at the World Championships every year from 2013 to 2015. In 2016, Biles competed at the Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and won four gold medals and one bronze medal. She became the first American gymnast to win four gold medals in a single Olympic Games. After the Olympics, Biles took a break from competition, but returned to the sport in 2018. She won the all-around title at the U.S. National Championships that year, and then won the all-around title at the World Championships in Doha, Qatar. Biles continued to dominate the sport in 2019, winning the all-around title at the U.S. National Championships and the World Championships. Biles is known for her incredible athleticism and her ability to perform difficult skills with ease. She has a signature move named after her, the Biles, which is a double layout with a half twist. She has also performed other difficult skills, such as a triple-double on floor exercise and a double-double dismount on balance beam. Off the competition floor, Biles has been an advocate for mental health and has spoken openly about her own struggles with anxiety. She has also been a vocal advocate for survivors of sexual abuse, and has criticized USA Gymnastics for its handling of the Larry Nassar scandal. Biles has won numerous awards and accolades throughout her career, including being named the Associated Press Female Athlete of the Year in 2019 and 2020.

Roger Federer.passage: Roger Federer is a Swiss professional tennis player who is widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. He was born on August 8, 1981, in Basel, Switzerland, and began playing tennis at the age of eight. Federer turned professional in 1998 and has since won 20 Grand Slam singles titles, the most in history by a male player. Federer's playing style is characterized by his exceptional footwork, fluid strokes, and all-court game. He is known for his ability to hit winners from any position on the court and his precision and consistency in his shots. Federer's serve is also a major weapon, with his ability to hit aces and serve-and-volley tactics. Federer's career highlights include winning the Australian Open six times, the French Open once, Wimbledon eight times, and the US Open five times. He has also won a record 103 ATP singles titles, including 28 ATP Masters 1000 titles. Federer has spent a total of 310 weeks as the world No. 1, the most in history by a male player. Federer has also been a dominant force in doubles, winning eight Grand Slam doubles titles and a gold medal in the 2008 Beijing Olympics. He has also won the ATP World Tour Finals six times and has been a member of the Swiss Davis Cup team since 1999. Off the court, Federer is known for his philanthropic work, particularly through his Roger Federer Foundation, which supports education projects in Africa and Switzerland. He is also a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador and has been involved in various charitable initiatives throughout his career. Federer's longevity and continued success on the court have made him a beloved figure in the tennis world and beyond. He has inspired countless fans and players with his grace, sportsmanship, and dedication to the sport.

Lionel Messi.passage: Lionel Messi is an Argentine professional footballer who plays as a forward for Paris Saint-Germain and the Argentina national team. Widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, he has won numerous awards and accolades throughout his career. Born on June 24, 1987, in Rosario, Argentina, Messi began playing football at a young age and joined the youth team of Newell's Old Boys. At the age of 13, he moved to Spain to join Barcelona's youth academy, La Masia. He made his first-team debut for Barcelona in 2004 and quickly established himself as a key player for the club. Messi's playing style is characterized by his speed, agility, and technical ability. He is known for his dribbling skills, close control of the ball, and ability to create scoring opportunities for himself and his teammates. He has also been praised for his work rate and defensive contributions. Throughout his career, Messi has won numerous individual awards, including seven Ballon d'Or titles, which are awarded to the best player in the world. He has also won numerous team trophies with Barcelona, including ten La Liga titles, seven Copa del Rey titles, and four UEFA Champions League titles. Messi has also had success with the Argentina national team, although he has yet to win a major international tournament. He has helped Argentina reach the final of the Copa America three times and the final of the World Cup once. Off the field, Messi is known for his philanthropic work. He has established the Leo Messi Foundation, which aims to provide healthcare, education, and sports opportunities to children in need. He has also been involved in various charitable initiatives, including UNICEF and the fight against childhood cancer. In August 2021, Messi signed with Paris Saint-Germain after spending his entire professional career with Barcelona. Despite the change in clubs, he remains one of the most highly regarded and influential players in the world of football.

Michael Phelps.passage: Michael Phelps is a retired American swimmer who is widely regarded as one of the greatest athletes of all time. Born on June 30, 1985, in Baltimore, Maryland, Phelps began swimming at the age of seven and quickly showed a natural talent for the sport. He trained under coach Bob Bowman, who would become his mentor and guide him throughout his career. Phelps made his Olympic debut at the age of 15 at the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney, Australia, where he competed in the 200-meter butterfly and finished fifth. He went on to compete in the 2004, 2008, 2012, and 2016 Summer Olympics, winning a total of 28 medals, including 23 gold medals, three silver medals, and two bronze medals. His 23 gold medals are the most won by any athlete in Olympic history. Phelps' dominance in the pool was due to his incredible work ethic, natural talent, and ability to perform under pressure. He was known for his long, powerful strokes and his ability to maintain his speed throughout a race. He also had a strong mental game, often visualizing his races and mentally preparing himself for competition. Phelps' success in the pool was not without its challenges. He struggled with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) as a child and later battled depression and substance abuse. In 2014, he was arrested for driving under the influence and entered a rehabilitation program. He has since become an advocate for mental health awareness and has spoken openly about his struggles. In addition to his Olympic success, Phelps also holds numerous world records in swimming. He retired from competitive swimming after the 2016 Summer Olympics but has remained involved in the sport as a commentator and mentor to young swimmers. He has also pursued other interests, including golf and entrepreneurship. Phelps' legacy in the world of sports is undeniable. He has inspired countless young athletes to pursue their dreams and has shown that with hard work and dedication, anything is possible. His impact on the sport of swimming and on the world of sports as a whole will be felt for generations to come.

She attended Stone Ridge School of the Sacred Heart in Bethesda, Maryland, where she was a member of the school's swim team. Ledecky's breakthrough performance came at the 2012 London Olympics, where she won the gold medal in the 800-meter freestyle at the age of 15. Usain Bolt.passage: Usain St Leo Bolt is a retired Jamaican sprinter widely considered to be the greatest sprinter of all time. He was born on August 21, 1986, in Sherwood Content, a small town in Jamaica. Bolt is known for his incredible speed, his charismatic personality, and his record-breaking performances on the track. Bolt first gained international attention at the 2008 Beijing Olympics, where he won three gold medals and set world records in the 100m, 200m, and 4x100m relay. He repeated this feat at the 2012 London Olympics, becoming the first athlete to win six Olympic gold medals in sprinting. Bolt also won three gold medals at the 2009 World Championships, three gold medals at the 2011 World Championships, and two gold medals at the 2013 World Championships. Bolt's dominance in sprinting is due to his incredible physical abilities. He is 6'5" tall, which is unusually tall for a sprinter, and has a stride length of 2.44 meters, which is longer than most of his competitors. Bolt's top speed has been measured at 27.8 miles per hour, which is faster than the speed limit in most residential areas. In addition to his physical abilities, Bolt is known for his showmanship and his ability to perform under pressure. He is famous for his "Lightning Bolt" pose, which he strikes after winning races, and for his playful antics on and off the track. Bolt has also shown remarkable resilience in the face of adversity. In the 2011 World Championships, he was disqualified from the 100m final for a false start, but he bounced back to win gold in the 200m and the 4x100m relay. Bolt retired from competitive sprinting in 2017, after the World Championships in London. He finished his career with eight Olympic gold medals and 11 World Championship gold medals, as well as numerous world records. Bolt's legacy as the greatest sprinter of all time is secure, and he continues to inspire young athletes around the world.

Tom Brady.passage: Tom Brady is an American football quarterback who is widely considered one of the greatest players of all time. He was born on August 3, 1977, in San Mateo, California, and grew up in a family of sports enthusiasts. Brady attended Junipero Serra High School, where he played football, basketball, and baseball. Despite being a talented athlete, he was not heavily recruited by college football programs and ultimately chose to attend the University of Michigan. At Michigan, Brady initially served as a backup quarterback before earning the starting job in his junior year. He led the Wolverines to an Orange Bowl victory in 2000 and was named team captain in his senior year. Despite his success in college, Brady was not selected until the sixth round of the 2000 NFL Draft by the New England Patriots. Brady's early years in the NFL were marked by his role as a backup to starting quarterback Drew Bledsoe. However, in 2001, Bledsoe was injured in a game against the New York Jets, and Brady was called upon to take over. He led the Patriots to a victory in that game and went on to lead the team to a Super Bowl victory that season, earning Super Bowl MVP honors in the process. Over the next two decades, Brady established himself as one of the most dominant quarterbacks in NFL history. He led the Patriots to six Super Bowl victories, including four in a five-year span from 2001 to 2005. He also won three NFL MVP awards and was named to the Pro Bowl 14 times. In 2020, Brady signed with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers after spending his entire career with the Patriots. Despite being in his 40s, he led the Buccaneers to a Super Bowl victory in his first season with the team, earning his fifth Super Bowl MVP award in the process. Off the field, Brady has been involved in a number of philanthropic endeavors. He has worked with organizations such as Best Buddies International and the Boys and Girls Clubs of America, and he has also established his own charitable foundation, the TB12 Foundation. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest quarterbacks of all time and has left an indelible mark on the sport of football.

In 2016, she became one of the first professional athletes to kneel during the national anthem in solidarity with NFL quarterback Colin Kaepernick's protest against police brutality and racial injustice. Rapinoe has also been recognized for her philanthropic work, including her support of the LGBTQ+ community and her work with the Women's Sports Foundation. Throughout her career, Rapinoe has received numerous awards and honors, including being named the FIFA Women's World Player of the Year in 2019. She is widely regarded as one of the greatest female soccer players of all time and continues to inspire young athletes around the world.

Kobe Bryant.passage: Kobe Bryant was an American professional basketball player who played his entire 20-year career with the Los Angeles Lakers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). Widely regarded as one of the greatest basketball players of all time, he won five NBA championships, two Olympic gold medals, and was an 18-time All-Star, a 15-time member of the All-NBA Team, a 12-time member of the All-Defensive Team, and the 2008 NBA Most Valuable Player (MVP). Bryant is also the fourth-highest scorer in NBA history, with 33,643 points. Bryant was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and was the son of former NBA player Joe "Jellybean" Bryant. He attended Lower Merion High School in Ardmore, Pennsylvania, where he was recognized as the top high school basketball player in the country. After graduating in 1996, he declared for the NBA draft and was selected 13th overall by the Charlotte Hornets, who then traded him to the Lakers. Bryant quickly established himself as one of the best players in the league, winning his first NBA championship in 2000 alongside teammate Shaquille O'Neal. The duo went on to win two more championships in 2001 and 2002, but their relationship deteriorated, and O'Neal was traded to the Miami Heat in 2004. Bryant continued to excel, leading the Lakers to two more championships in 2009 and 2010, with teammate Pau Gasol. Off the court, Bryant was known for his work ethic and dedication to the game. He was also an accomplished businessman, with ventures in media, technology, and sports. In 2018, he won an Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film for his production of "Dear Basketball," a tribute to his love for the game. Tragically, Bryant died in a helicopter crash on January 26, 2020, along with his daughter Gianna and seven others. His death sent shockwaves throughout the world, with tributes pouring in from fans, athletes, and celebrities alike. He was posthumously inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame in May 2021, cementing his legacy as one of the greatest basketball players of all time.

She was born on October 16, 1997, in Chūō-ku, Osaka, Japan, to a Haitian father and a Japanese mother. Osaka began playing tennis at the age of three and moved to the United States with her family when she was just three years old. Osaka's breakthrough year came in 2018 when she won her first WTA title at the Indian Wells Open. She then went on to win her first Grand Slam title at the US Open, defeating Serena Williams in a controversial final. Osaka's victory made her the first Japanese player to win a Grand Slam singles title. In 2019, Osaka won her second Grand Slam title at the Australian Open, defeating Petra Kvitová in the final. She then went on to win the Pan Pacific Open in her hometown of Osaka, Japan. Later that year, Osaka was named the WTA Player of the Year. Osaka has been praised for her powerful serve and aggressive playing style. She is also known for her off-court activism, particularly her support for the Black Lives Matter movement. In 2020, Osaka withdrew from the Western & Southern Open and the US Open in protest of racial injustice and police brutality. In addition to her success on the court, Osaka has also become a prominent figure in the fashion world. She has collaborated with several major brands, including Nike, Louis Vuitton, and TAG Heuer. Overall, Naomi Osaka is widely regarded as one of the best tennis players in the world and a trailblazer for Japanese and biracial athletes. Her talent, activism, and fashion sense have made her a beloved figure both on and off the court.

Luka Doncic.passage: Luka Doncic is a Slovenian professional basketball player who currently plays for the Dallas Mavericks in the National Basketball Association (NBA). He was born on February 28, 1999, in Ljubljana, Slovenia, and began playing basketball at a young age. Doncic's father, Sasa Doncic, was also a professional basketball player and played for the Slovenian national team. Doncic began his professional career at the age of 16, playing for Real Madrid in the Spanish Liga ACB. He quickly became one of the team's top players and helped lead them to several championships, including the EuroLeague title in 2018. During his time with Real Madrid, Doncic was named the EuroLeague MVP and the ACB Best Young Player. In 2018, Doncic declared for the NBA draft and was selected third overall by the Atlanta Hawks. However, he was immediately traded to the Dallas Mavericks in exchange for Trae Young and a future first-round draft pick. Doncic made an immediate impact in his rookie season, averaging 21.2 points, 7.8 rebounds, and 6.0 assists per game. He was named the NBA Rookie of the Year and became the youngest player in NBA history to record a triple-double. Doncic continued to improve in his second season, averaging 28.8 points, 9.4 rebounds, and 8.8 assists per game. He was named an All-Star for the first time and led the Mavericks to the playoffs, where they were eliminated in the first round by the Los Angeles Clippers. Lindsey Vonn.passage:
Lindsey Vonn is a retired American alpine ski racer who is widely regarded as one of the greatest female skiers of all time. Born on October 18, 1984, in Saint Paul, Minnesota, Vonn began skiing at the age of two and quickly showed a natural talent for the sport. She began competing in local races at the age of six and by the time she was a teenager, she was already a rising star in the skiing world. Vonn made her World Cup debut in 2000 at the age of 16 and quickly established herself as a force to be reckoned with. She won her first World Cup race in 2004 and went on to win a total of 82 World Cup races over the course of her career, the most by any female skier in history. She also won four overall World Cup titles, three downhill titles, and a super-G title. Vonn's success on the slopes was not without its challenges. She suffered numerous injuries throughout her career, including a broken arm, a torn ACL, and a fractured ankle. Despite these setbacks, she continued to compete at the highest level and became known for her tenacity and determination. In addition to her World Cup success, Vonn also won Olympic and World Championship medals. She won a gold medal in downhill at the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver and a bronze medal in downhill at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang. She also won seven medals at the World Championships, including two gold medals in downhill and a gold medal in super-G.

Vonn announced her retirement from skiing in 2019, citing the toll that injuries had taken on her body. She remains a beloved figure in the skiing world and a role model for young athletes. In addition to her skiing career, Vonn is also known for her philanthropic work, including her Lindsey Vonn Foundation, which supports young girls in sports.

Jeter made his major league debut in 1995, and he quickly established himself as one of the game's top young players. He won the American League Rookie of the Year award that season, and he helped lead the Yankees to their first World Series championship in 18 years in 1996. Jeter would go on to win four more World Series titles with the Yankees, in 1998, 1999, 2000, and 2009. Over the course of his career, Jeter was known for his clutch hitting, his exceptional defense at shortstop, and his leadership on and off the field. He was a 14-time All-Star, a five-time Gold Glove winner, and a five-time Silver Slugger award winner. He finished his career with a .310 batting average, 3,465 hits, 260 home runs, and 1,311 RBI. Off the field, Jeter was known for his philanthropic work and his business ventures. He founded the Turn 2 Foundation in 1996, which aims to help young people avoid drug and alcohol addiction. He also launched the Players' Tribune website in 2014, which allows athletes to share their stories and connect with fans. Jeter retired from baseball after the 2014 season, and he was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 2020. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest shortstops in baseball history, and his number 2 jersey was retired by the Yankees in 2017.

Los Angeles Lakers..passage: The Los Angeles Lakers are an American professional basketball team based in Los Angeles. The Lakers compete in the National Basketball Association (NBA) as a member of the league's Western Conference Pacific Division. The Lakers play their home games at Staples Center, an arena shared with the NBA's Los Angeles Clippers, the Los Angeles Sparks of the Women's National Basketball Association, and the Los Angeles Kings of the National Hockey League. The Lakers are one of the most successful teams in the history of the NBA, and have won 17 NBA championships, tied with the Boston Celtics for the most in NBA history. The franchise began with the 1947 purchase of a disbanded team, the Detroit Gems of the National Basketball League (NBL). The new team began playing in Minneapolis, Minnesota, calling themselves the Minneapolis Lakers. Initially a member of the NBL, the Lakers won the 1948 NBL championship before joining the rival Basketball Association of America, where they would win five of the next six championships, led by star George Mikan. After struggling financially in the late 1950s following Mikan's retirement, they relocated to Los Angeles before the 1960–61 season. Led by Hall of Famers Elgin Baylor and Jerry West, Los Angeles made the NBA Finals six times in the 1960s, but lost each series to the Celtics, beginning their long and storied rivalry. In 1972, the Lakers won their first NBA championship, led by Wilt Chamberlain and Gail Goodrich, who were then reinforced the following season by the 1971–72 NBA Coach of the Year Bill Sharman. The Lakers continued to struggle throughout the 1970s before they finally won their next championship in 1980, under the leadership of Finals MVP Magic Johnson. Johnson, along with fellow Hall of Famers Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and James Worthy, would lead the Lakers to five championships in the 1980s, culminating with a run of three consecutive titles from 2000 to 2002, led by Finals MVP Shaquille O'Neal and the young Kobe Bryant. After Bryant's retirement following the 2015–16 season, the team underwent a rebuilding phase, but returned to championship contention in 2020, winning their 17th championship behind the play of Finals MVP LeBron James and All-Star Anthony Davis.

Portugal has a mixed economy, with services, industry, and agriculture all contributing to its GDP. The country is a major producer of cork, wine, and olive oil, and has a growing tech industry. Tourism is also an important sector, with millions of visitors coming to Portugal each year to enjoy its beaches, historic sites, and natural beauty. Despite its small size, Portugal has had a significant impact on world history, particularly during the Age of Discovery, when Portuguese explorers discovered new trade routes and established colonies in Africa, Asia, and the Americas. Juventus..passage: Juventus Football Club, commonly referred to as Juventus or Juve, is a professional football club based in Turin, Italy. Founded in 1897 by a group of Torinese students, the club has worn a black and white striped home kit since 1903 and has played home matches in different grounds around its city, the latest being the 41,507-capacity Juventus Stadium. Nicknamed Vecchia Signora ("the Old Lady"), the club has won 36 official league titles, 13 Coppa Italia titles and eight Supercoppa Italiana titles, being the record holder for all these competitions; two Intercontinental Cups, two European Cups / UEFA Champions Leagues, one European Cup Winners' Cup, a joint national record of three UEFA Cups, two UEFA Super Cups and a joint national record of one UEFA Intertoto Cup. Consequently, the side leads the historical Federazione Italiana Giuoco Calcio (FIGC) ranking whilst on the international stage occupies the 5th position in Europe and the eleventh in the world for most confederation titles won with eleven trophies, having led the UEFA ranking during seven seasons since its inception in 1979, the most for an Italian team and joint second overall. Juventus' home colours have been the black and white stripes since 1903. The club has a long-standing rivalry with Inter Milan and matches between the two teams are called Derby d'Italia. The club is also one of the founders of the European Club Association (ECA), which was formed after the dissolution of the G-14, a collection of Europe's most elite clubs.

Real Madrid..passage: Real Madrid Club de Fútbol, commonly referred to as Real Madrid, is a Spanish professional football club based in Madrid. Founded in 1902 as Madrid Football Club, the team has traditionally worn a white home kit since inception. The word Real is Spanish for "royal" and was bestowed to the club by King Alfonso XIII in 1920 together with the royal crown in the emblem. The team has played its home matches in the 81,044-capacity Santiago Bernabéu Stadium in downtown Madrid since 1947. Unlike most European sporting entities, Real Madrid's members (socios) have owned and operated the club throughout its history. The club was estimated to be worth €3.8 billion ($4.24 billion) in 2019, and in the 2018–19 season it was the second highest-earning football club in the world, with an annual revenue of €757.3 million. The club is one of the most widely supported teams in the world. Real Madrid has won 13 European Cup/UEFA Champions League titles, more than any other club, and four FIFA Club World Cup titles, a record seven UEFA Super Cup titles and 34 La Liga titles. The club has also won 19 Copa del Rey titles, and two Copa Eva Duarte titles. Real Madrid was recognised as the FIFA Club of the 20th Century on 11 December 2000, and received the FIFA Centennial Order of Merit on 20 May 2004. The club was also awarded Best European Club of the 20th Century by the IFFHS on 11 May 2010. In June 2017, the team succeeded in becoming the first club to win back-to-back Champions Leagues, then made it three in a row in May 2018, extending their lead atop the UEFA club rankings.

Belgium..passage: Belgium, officially the Kingdom of Belgium, is a country in Western Europe. The capital and largest city is Brussels; other major cities are Antwerp, Ghent, Charleroi, Liège, Bruges, Namur, and Leuven. Belgium is a federal parliamentary democracy under a constitutional monarchy, with King Philippe as head of state. It is divided into three regions: Flanders in the north, Wallonia in the south, and the Brussels-Capital Region. Brussels is the smallest and most densely populated region, as well as the richest region in terms of GDP per capita.
